newsitem.title: USA: Cotton Valley looks for merger deal.
newsitem.headline: Cotton Valley looks for merger deal.

text.p: Cotton Valley Resources Corp said Monday it had hired Van Kasper & Co to help it evaluate "strategic alternatives" with other companies.
A spokeswoman for the oil and gas company later told Reuters that Cotton Valley was talking with a number of companies about either acquiring or being acquired.
"We're looking for the proper fit," she said, explaining that the company would rather merge with a larger one in order to get access to more capital and greater production capacity.
Based in Texas, Cotton Valley had about $22 million in revenues in 1996, she said.
Van Kasper is a research, investment banking and retail and institutional brokerage.
